Description: Much of a South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim, now composed of two sets of joining fragments and some plaster; interior: reserved band at top of lip, glazed black below; exterior: narrow black line at top of lip; lip and handle zone reserved with band between, glazed below; handle glazed black save for underside and interior surface; reserved underside of foot save for accidental brush strokes.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile finds parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C or Type 9A. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 or B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are few at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.146) (Phase 3)
